c74object.name: ears.features~
c74object.description: Perform descriptor analysis on the incoming buffer via the Essentia library

objarg.name: features
objarg.description: A list of symbols, each associated with a feature to be computed

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object will open the display window for the output buffer(s). If more than 10 buffers are to be output, only the first 10 are displayed.

method.name: list/llll
method.description:
A list or llll in the first inlet is supposed to contain buffer names and will trigger the buffer processing and output the processed buffer names (depending on the naming attribute).
A number or an llll in the second inlet is expected to contain a features threshold (depending on the ampunit) or an envelope (also see envampunit).

method.name: number
method.description: A number in the second inlet sets the features parameter (depending on the ampunit).

method.name: reset
method.description: If the naming attribute is set to 'Dynamic', the reset message will force the dynamic naming to cycle and restart from the first used name. This is especially useful in combination with iterative mechanisms.

method.name: write
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

attribute.name: ampunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for amplitudes: Linear (default) or Decibel (0dB corresponding to 1. in the linear scale).

attribute.name: antimeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for analysis values: Milliseconds, Samples, Relative (0. to 1. as a percentage of the buffer length). The default is always Milliseconds except for the ears.repeat~ module (Relative).

attribute.name: bufinterp
envattack
attribute.description: Sets the attack time for computing envelopes (the unit depends on the envtimeunit attribute) Floating point values are allowed.

attribute.name: envrelease
attribute.description: Sets the attack time for computing envelopes (the unit depends on the envtimeunit attribute) Floating point values are allowed.

attribute.name: envtimeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for time values inside envelopes: Milliseconds, Samples, Relative (0. to 1. as a percentage of the buffer length). The default is Relative.

attribute.name: frequnit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for pitch values: Hertz (default), BPM, Cents, MIDI

attribute.name: naming
attribute.description:
Chooses the output buffer naming policy:
0 (Copy): the buffer name is copied from the input (in-place modification). Notice that some objects do not allow this policy.
1 (Static): a single buffer (and hence buffer name) is created, and always used as output.
2 (Dynamic): a new buffer (and buffer name) is created for each new command. Beware! This may allocate a lot of memory! You can always cycle on a fixed set of names via the reset message.
You can use a shortcut to define the naming policy via a first symbolic argument: use = for copy, - for static and ! for dynamic.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the "t" specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: outname
attribute.description: Sets the name for each one of the buffer outlets. Leave blank to auto-assign unique names.

attribute.name: pitchunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for pitch values: Cents (default), MIDI, Hertz (frequency), or frequency ratio.

attribute.name: summary
summaryweight
attribute.description: Sets the summarization weight (only applicable when summary is set to "Mean"): None, RMS, Loudness.

attribute.name: timeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for time values: Milliseconds, Samples, Relative (0. to 1. as a percentage of the buffer length). The default is always Milliseconds except for the ears.repeat~, ears.paulstretch~ modules (Relative).
